text: Listen, Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan so you can dispossess the nations there, people greater and stronger than you who live in large cities with extremely high fortifications.

They include the <st data-num="01121 06062">Anakites</st>,<n id="1" /> a <st data-num="01419" class="">numerous</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07311" class="">tall</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="04310" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="03045">know about</st> and <st data-num="0859 08085">of whom it is said</st>, “<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> is able to <st data-num="03320 06440">resist</st> the <st data-num="01121 06061">Anakites</st>?”
Understand today that the Lord your God who goes before you is a devouring fire; he will defeat and subdue them before you. You will dispossess and destroy them quickly just as he has told you.

Do not think to yourself after the Lord your God has driven them out before you, “Because of my own righteousness the Lord has brought me here to possess this land.” It is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is driving them out ahead of you.

It is not because of your righteousness, or even your inner uprightness, that you have come here to possess their land. Instead, because of the wickedness of these nations, the Lord your God is driving them out ahead of you in order to confirm the promise he made on oath to your ancestors, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Understand, therefore, that it is not because of your righteousness that the Lord your God is about to give you this good land as a possession, for you are a stubborn people!
Remember—don’t ever forget—how you provoked the Lord your God in the wilderness; from the time you left the land of Egypt until you came to this place you were constantly rebelling against him.

At <st data-num="02722" class="">Horeb</st> you <st data-num="07107" class="">provoked</st> <st data-num="03068" class="">him</st> and <st data-num="03068" class="">he</st> <st data-num="0599" class="">was angry</st> enough with you to <st data-num="08045" class="">destroy</st> you.
When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that the Lord made with you, I remained there 40 days and nights, eating and drinking nothing.
The Lord gave me the two stone tablets, written by the very finger of God, and on them was everything he said to you at the mountain from the midst of the fire at the time of that assembly.
Now at the end of the 40 days and nights the Lord presented me with the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.

And <st data-num="03068" class="">he</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, “<st data-num="06965" class="">Get up</st>, <st data-num="03381" class="">go down</st> <st data-num="04118" class="">at once</st> from <st data-num="02088" class="">here</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> your <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> you <st data-num="03318" class="">brought out</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> have <st data-num="07843" class="">sinned</st>! They have <st data-num="04118" class="">quickly</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">turned</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="01870" class="">way</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> them and have <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> for themselves a <st data-num="04541" class="">cast metal image</st>.”<n id="1" />

Moreover, <st data-num="03068" class="">he</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, “I have <st data-num="07200" class="">taken note</st> of <st data-num="02088" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>; <st data-num="01931" class="">they</st> are a <st data-num="07186 06203">stubborn</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05971" class="">lot</st>!
Stand aside and I will destroy them, obliterating their very name from memory, and I will make you into a stronger and more numerous nation than they are.”
So I turned and went down the mountain while it was blazing with fire; the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.
When I looked, you had indeed sinned against the Lord your God and had cast for yourselves a metal calf; you had quickly turned aside from the way he had commanded you!

I <st data-num="08610" class="">grabbed</st> the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03871" class="">tablets</st>, <st data-num="07993" class="">threw</st> them <st data-num="07993">down</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="07665" class="">shattered</st> them before your very <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st>.
Then I again fell down before the Lord for 40 days and nights; I ate and drank nothing because of all the sin you had committed, doing such evil before the Lord as to enrage him.
For I was terrified at the Lord’s intense anger that threatened to destroy you. But he listened to me this time as well.
The Lord was also angry enough at Aaron to kill him, but at that time I prayed for him too.

As for your <st data-num="02403" class="">sinful thing</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you had <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st>, the <st data-num="05695" class="">calf</st>, I <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> it, <st data-num="08313" class="">melted</st> it <st data-num="0784" class="">down</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03807 02912">ground</st> it <st data-num="03190" class="">up</st> <st data-num="05704 0834">until</st> it was as <st data-num="01851" class="">fine</st> as <st data-num="06083" class="">dust</st>, and <st data-num="07993" class="">tossed</st> the <st data-num="06083" class="">dust</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="05158" class="">stream</st> that <st data-num="03381 04480">flows down</st> the <st data-num="02022" class="">mountain</st>.
Moreover, you continued to provoke the Lord at Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth Hattaavah.
And when he sent you from Kadesh Barnea and told you, “Go up and possess the land I have given you,” you rebelled against the Lord your God and would neither believe nor obey him.
You have been rebelling against him from the very first day I knew you!
I lay flat on the ground before the Lord for 40 days and nights, for he had said he would destroy you.
I prayed to him: O, Sovereign Lord, do not destroy your people, your valued property that you have powerfully redeemed, whom you brought out of Egypt by your strength.

<st data-num="02142" class="">Remember</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>, <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st>, and <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>; <st data-num="0408 06437 0413">ignore</st> the <st data-num="07190" class="">stubbornness</st>, <st data-num="07562" class="">wickedness</st>, and <st data-num="02403" class="">sin</st> of <st data-num="02088" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>.

Otherwise the people of the land from which you brought us will say, “The Lord was unable to bring them to the land he promised them, and because of his hatred for them he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.”
They are your people, your valued property, whom you brought out with great strength and power.
